items.content_html:
Description

This is a follow up to #25749.

In this PR:

  • overflow page: An example is added for overlay to show difference from auto.
  • overflow-x and overflow-y pages: The overlay note is added alongside the auto description. Missed adding this in #25749.

Related issues and pull requests

Doc issue tracker: #25355
Spec: https://w3c.github.io/csswg-drafts/css-overflow/#overflow-control

/cc @estelle
items.title: docs(fx112-css): Add overlay example

items.content_html:
Fx113 adds support for CompressionStream, constructor and co

additional changes:

  • typo fix writeable -> writable. This causes an error in the examples, changing leftovers for spelling consistency in relnotes.
  • Add details on the compression methods for good measure.

Related issues and pull requests:

  • Parent issue #26158

Bugzilla:

  • Tracking bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1823619

TODO:

  • improvements on examples (nice to have)
items.title: relnote(Fx113): Compression Streams API supported by default

items.content_html:
Bumps markdownlint-cli2 from 0.6.0 to 0.7.0.

Changelog

Sourced from markdownlint-cli2's changelog.

0.7.0

  • Add support for extends in config property of .markdownlint-cli2.* files
  • Build and publish davidanson/markdownlint-cli2-rules Docker container image
  • Update dependencies (including markdownlint)
Commits
  • e54fbe2 Update to version 0.7.0.
  • ecb81e3 Add new markdownlint-rule-trace-template-headers custom rule to markdownlint-...
  • 7924ea6 Remove "next" tag for pre-commit hooks for davidanson/markdownlint-cli2-rules...
  • 1b5cf06 Add Node 20 to CI matrix.
  • fe9ebc1 Bump globby from 13.1.3 to 13.1.4
  • 0be1213 Bump eslint from 8.37.0 to 8.38.0
  • b9088db Update OutputFormatters.md to document the additional fileName property on ea...
  • c19bf55 Remove broken link from OutputFormatters.md.
  • 9390fb1 Add missing doc directory to linkcheck and spellcheck actions, simplify param...
  • 47f2dfa Add new ignores to dictionary for spell-check exclusion.
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot will merge this PR once CI passes on it, as requested by @mdn-bot.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: Bump markdownlint-cli2 from 0.6.0 to 0.7.0

Motivation

The example is broken.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Fix incorrect case in example on the WebExtension action API.

items.content_html:
The bookCreate() method in the 'populatedb.js' file takes an array of genres as one of the arguments instead of the expected objectId schemaType.

Description

  • changed schemaType of the genre field of BookSchema from Schema.Types.ObjectId to Array.

Motivation

  • Database population fails when populatedb.js is run. This happens because Book model validation fails. Mongoose expects schemaType.Types.ObjectId instead of an Array of genre objects when invoking the bookCreate method. The change satisfies this expectation.

Additional details

  • https://mongoosejs.com/docs/schematypes.html

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: changed schemaType of genre field of BookSchema

items.content_html:
Description

These pages (lang and dir) were missing on manifest's MDN documentation

Motivation

These properties are mentioned in description and short_name, and they exist on https://w3c.github.io/manifest/ but their page is not created.

Additional details

I found these properties on https://w3c.github.io/manifest/
items.title: Adding the `dir` and `lang` pages of the Web App Manifest

items.content_html:
As described in the note here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/contain#try_it
the containing block is created when contain is set to value: layout, paint, strict or content, and not just 'paint'.

Description

The docs for containing block are incomplete they state that just contain value of paint creates a new containing block but the docs for the contain CSS property says otherwise.

Motivation

incomplete documentation

Additional details

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/contain#try_it

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update Layout and the containing block section for contain CSS property

items.content_html:
Four preferences are flipped to true by default in 113, specifically:

  • layout.css.more_color_4.enabled (for functional notations lab() etc.)
  • layout.css.forced-color-adjust.enabled (for forced-color-adjust prop)
  • layout.css.color-mix.enabled and layout.css.color-mix.color-spaces.enabled (for color-mix() functional notation)

Related issues and bugs:

  • parent issue #26147
  • BCD mdn/browser-compat-data#19426

Bugzilla:

  • Tracking bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1352753
  • Bugs for individual flags:
    • more_color_4: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1813497
    • forced-color-adjust: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1818819
    • color-mix and color-mix.color-spaces: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1824526
items.title: relnote(Fx113): CSS Color lvl 4 features are enabled by default

items.content_html:
Description

I added a result bloc to the example, because here is mentioned:

After the different code blocks, please use a last "Result" block before using the EmbedLiveSample macro (see above). This way, the semantic of the example is made clearer for both the reader and any tools that would parse the page (e.g. screen reader, web crawler).

Besides the height of the example was to increased to remove the scrollbar.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: CSS `text-decoration` example box modified

items.content_html:
FF113 removed CanvasRenderingContext2D.mozTextStyle in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1294362.
This was replaced a long time ago by CanvasRenderingContext2D.font, and had been deprecated and hidden behind a pref for ages.

All this does is add a release note and remove an old gecko note.

Related docs work can be tracked in #26148
items.title: FF113 Removes CanvasRenderingContext2D::mozTextStyle

items.content_html:
The syntax for the ray() function (value in offset-path) has been updated in Fx112.

  • <ray-size> is now optional.
  • The default value of <ray-size> is closest-side.

Changes in this PR

  • Updates the ray() function description in the existing offset-path page, adds links to some shape pages

  • Adds a new page for the ray() function. The webref is not updated with the new syntax so I have not included a "Formal syntax" section. I've added the syntax to the "Syntax" section for now.

Spec: https://drafts.fxtf.org/motion/#ray-function
Firefox bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1820071

Support in browsers

  • Firefox: ray() is available behind the flag layout.css.motion-path-ray.enabled .
  • Chrome: some offset-path: ray() functionality is available with "Experimental Web Platform features" enabled but the syntax implementation is not in sync with the latest spec. The BCD table on offset-path page contains a row on ray() that indicates complete support, which is contrary to what I saw in testing.

Codepens

Codepens for the examples used in the doc can be found here (tested in Firefox behind the flag):
Example 1: https://codepen.io/dipikabh/pen/yLReQaZ
Example 2: https://codepen.io/dipikabh/pen/PoyNQdz

Caveat

The functionality is still undergoing discussions:

  • The contain keyword behavior is due to be fixed in Firefox (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1821450) as a result of w3c/fxtf-drafts#363.
  • More change in behavior is expected to come via w3c/fxtf-drafts#504.

To Do

  • Open BCD PR - mdn/browser-compat-data#19421
  • Update mdn/data - mdn/data#661
  • Update Fx112 release note - #26275

Related issues

Doc issue tracker: #25358
items.title: docs(fx112-css-ray): Create new page for ray() function

items.content_html:
Description

This PR updates the content for styling the select and datalists elements capabilities around the different browsers. The mentioned issue was a problem for past browsers and does not apply to today's browsers. However, to keep the content around it updated, I have added a note around it.

Motivation

Correctness of the doc so that it helps other fellow members of the community

Related issues and pull requests

Issue :- #26182
items.title: Advanced form styling issues apply only to earlier browsers

items.title: scripting extension API is not MV3-only

items.content_html:
Description

Copied over the description of the auto value from grid-template-rows and grid-template-columns into grid-auto-rows and grid-auto-columns

Motivation

The description in grid-template-rows and grid-template-columns is more descriptive as a whole and also adds details about the auto value when outside a minmax() function.
items.title: Update value descriptions in grid-auto-rows/columns

items.content_html:
Description

Document the restrictions for which requests are matched by DNR.

Motivation

It is important to know relevant restrictions that hides requests from the declarativeNetRequest extension API. The relevant restrictions are not clearly documented.

Additional details

  • initiator does not require host permissions for main_frame/sub_frame, https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1825824

  • Document restricted requests (system & restricted domains) (no bug).

  • Document restricted requests (about:-pages from browsers), https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1826651

  • Document restricted requests (other extensions), https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1810753

Related issues and pull requests

This PR references the "Restricted domains" section that is introduced in #26188
items.title: Document which requests are restricted in DNR

items.content_html:
Description

As details of the new gecko_android sudkey in the android_specific_settings manifest key.

Also, removed the description of Microsoft Edge properties, which haven't been supported since it adopted Chromium, and remove the note about the safari subkey causing issues in Firefox 69 or earlier.

Motivation

Addresses the BCD requirements of Bug 1824237 Add support for new browser_specific_settings.gecko_android key.

Related issues and pull requests

Related BCD changes in PR #19363.
items.title: Addition of browser_specific_settings.gecko_android

items.content_html:
Description

  • use env var to hold build dir.
  • use --exclude param to skip copying *.map files to the build

Motivation

  1. We have use some hardcode var in many steps, it might be a bit hard to maintain. Use environment variables maybe a better idea (as the $BUILD_OUT_ROOT is not set before)
  2. Use --exclude param to skip copying *.map files, so we do not need to delete them after copying files.

Additional details

  • https://docs.github.com/en/actions/learn-github-actions/variables
  • https://linux.die.net/man/1/rsync
items.title: fix(pt-test): use env var to hold build dir
